definition[0]: three times as big, as much, or as many as something else
example[0]: They sold the house for treble the amount they paid for it.
definition[1]: to become three times as big in amount, size, or number, or to make something increase in this way
example[1]: Their profits have trebled in the last two years.
definition[2]: the upper half of the whole range of musical notes
definition[3]: a boy’s high singing voice, or a boy with a voice like this
definition[4]: the part of a musical work that is written for a treble voice or instrument
definition[5]: a treble voice or instrument produces high notes
definition[6]: to become three times as big in amount
example[2]: Net income more than trebled, to £5.7 million.
example[3]: A federal jury awarded $2 million in damages, to be trebled under antitrust law.
